meanings.definition: A Chinese silver or gold ingot used as currency.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people in China traded using sycees.
meanings.sent2: The merchant accepted sycees as payment for the goods.
meanings.sent3: The thief tried to steal the heavy sycees, but they were too bulky to carry.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than all the sycees in the world.
meanings.sent5: The glimmer of the sycees caught the sunlight, dazzling everyone around.

meanings.definition: A type of coin or money in ancient China.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, people exchanged gifts of sycees.
meanings.sent2: The emperor's portrait was engraved on the ancient sycees.
meanings.sent3: The children played with fake sycees, pretending to be rich merchants.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the jingle of sycees, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sycees clinking together echoed through the marketplace.
